answer:
We do not have a list of vaccines that people would have been offered based on birth year. You can contact your local public health unit and ask to speak with a public health nurse. The public health nurse can refer to the History of Immunization in BC section of the BCCDC Immunization Manual and can give you an idea of which vaccines you would have likely been offered. 
However, without a record of immunization a person is considered unimmunized.  You can find information on locating immunization records here. 
- Immunization Nurse
question: I was born in 1987 and my parents would have ensured I had all recommended immunisations, however I do not have a record. Can you provide a schedule I would have been on?
question_variation_0: can you provide a schedule I would have been on?
question_variation_2: what schedule of immunisation should i have been on
